articles.title: Towns scores 18 to carry Niagara over Fairfield 75-66
articles.description: LEWISTON, N.Y. (AP) — James Towns came off the bench to score 18 points to lift Niagara to a 75-66 win over Fairfield on Friday night.
articles.content:
LEWISTON, N.Y. (AP) James Towns came off the bench to score 18 points to lift Niagara to a 75-66 win over Fairfield on Friday night.
Both teams were playing their first Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference game of the season.
Raheem Solomon had 15 points for … [+878 chars]

articles.title: Shaw looking to rebound in first season with Blue Jays
articles.description: TORONTO (AP) — The biggest lesson Travis Shaw took away from a disappointing season is that this year can't get much worse.
articles.content:
TORONTO (AP) The biggest lesson Travis Shaw took away from a disappointing season is that this year can't get much worse.
Shaw, who signed a one-year deal worth $4 million with the Toronto Blue Jays late last month, is hoping a change of scenery and an oppor… [+1251 chars]

articles.author: By ERIC OLSON AP Sports Writer
articles.title: McConnell subs for Baker, leads Rutgers past Huskers 79-62
articles.description: LINCOLN, Neb. (AP) — Caleb McConnell made all eight of his shots from the field and scored a season-high 20 points starting in place of the injured Geo Baker, and Rutgers beat Nebraska 79-62 on Friday night for its fifth…
articles.content:
LINCOLN, Neb. (AP) Caleb McConnell made all eight of his shots from the field and scored a season-high 20 points starting in place of the injured Geo Baker, and Rutgers beat Nebraska 79-62 on Friday night for its fifth straight win.
Baker, the Scarlet Knight… [+1140 chars]

articles.title: Prosecutors: Husband looked up poison prior to wife's death
articles.description: VERNON, Conn. (AP) — Prosecutors say a Connecticut man who's set to stand trial for the murder of his wife used his home computer to search for homemade poison recipes before his wife was shot to death.
articles.content:
VERNON, Conn. (AP) Prosecutors say a Connecticut man who's set to stand trial for the murder of his wife used his home computer to search for homemade poison recipes before his wife was shot to death.
